title: President of the Local Government Board
text:
The President of the Local Government Board was a ministerial post, frequently a <a href="Cabinet%20%28government%29">Cabinet</a> position, in the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>, established in 1871. The <a href="Local%20Government%20Board">Local Government Board</a> itself was established in 1871 and took over supervisory functions from the <a href="Board%20of%20Trade">Board of Trade</a> and the <a href="Home%20Office">Home Office</a>, including the Local Government Act Office, which had been established by the <a href="Local%20Government%20Act%201858">Local Government Act 1858</a>, as well as the <a href="Poor%20Law%20Board">Poor Law Board</a>, which it replaced.
The position was abolished in 1919, following the <a href="World%20War%20I">First World War</a>, and the duties transferred to the new position of <a href="Secretary%20of%20State%20for%20Health">Minister of Health</a>.
